args.text: The PUGS bus sputters into view with a broken engine, its neon-puke exterior dripping rust as the trio — Whee-Zee’s snarling bassline bouncing off her spiked collar, Wörmer juggling smoke rings from his clove cigarettes between keyboard riffs, and Krötch drumming on oil cans like they’re trashcan totems of destruction — spills onto a cracked sidewalk. They commandeer an abandoned fire hydrant as their 'stage,' playing so loud even the pigeons in the rafters start moshing.

args.description: A group of pigeons begin moshing in the rafters, flapping wildly and clattering against the hydrant's metal body
Desobelle shoves Phi into the crowd for 'the vibes' and immediately starts flirting with Krötch over his drumsticks made of splintered pool cues
Callie tries to document the scene in her journal but ends up spray-painting anti-grammar graffiti on the hydrant's side

The noodles are 'corrupted' not by rebellion, but by discovering that eyeliner comes off easier if you rub your eyes while smoking clove cigarettes and screaming along to Whee-Zee’s anthem 'Crumble the Cake,' which is technically about dog treats but has *so* many double entendres
Servnak secretly joins a conga line of pug fans, only to get mistaken for the mayor after shouting 'BARKING ORDER!' at the top of his lungs
The final act ends with all six agents (PUGS + noodles) passed out in the gutter, Wörmer’s keyboard still playing 'Bohemian Rhapsody' on loop because he couldn’t find a stop button
